About Me

I'm a web developer focused on crafting clean, user-friendly experiences.

I love research, creating things, and using technology to connect people to resources within their communities. I have experience with JavaScript, React, and NodeJS.

In a previous career, I was an educational consultant empowering parents to become effective advocates for their children. After years of helping vulnerable clients in our fragile mental health care system, I competed in the first-ever Grow with Google Developer Challenge and was awarded a scholarship for Udacityâ€™s Front-End Nanodegree program.

I finished the Nanodegree and moved on to a full-stack computer science program that covered all aspects of web development including MERN stack, Java, algorithms, data structures, Agile and more. It has been a long journey, but I have found my passion and am seeking an entry-level role as a web developer at a company where I can learn, grow, and continue to master the craft.
